Array.Value: Your highness, how are you faring? If you're able to, try using [AllDir] and [Jump] to move around.
With [Interaction], you can gather or transport resources. Try cutting down a tree to get <sprite name=LogObject><color=#FFE331>Logs</color>, and put them in the Storage.
With [MoveNext], you can change the target in the aim to the diffrent one.
Aim your cursor at the <sprite name=FS_Base> <color=#FFE331>storage</color> container and use [DetailCheck] to take out some resources.
Use [DropObj] to drop the items you are currently carrying.
Use [AllDir2] to move your cursor around to aim at a target. Try looking around!
You can climb up to two tiles vertically using the [Jump] button.
You can jump across a one block gap using the [Jump} button when at the gap's ledge.
Well done! You can only place the <sprite name=FS_Blueprint><color=#FFE331>Blueprint</color> of a building if you have enough resources for it in your storage.

Now try building a <sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>City Entrance</color> by using [Command]. The building is located under the <sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>Royal structures</color> category.
Once you place all the required resources in the <sprite name=FS_Blueprint><color=#FFE331>Blue Print</color> you placed down, use the [Interaction] button to start building the structure.
With [WeaponOn], you will pull out your weapon, allowing you to attack entities using [Interaction].
To resume non-combat activities, press [WeaponOn] again to put your weapon away.
I think you are now well equipped to begin your adventure.
To rebuild the kingdom, you will need to have ratizens assisting you. It would be in your best interest to focus on accepting as many ratizens in the early start.

I took it into my own hands to find you some wanderers to assist you on your journey! Aim your cursor at the <sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>City Entrance</color> and use [DetailCheck] to accept new <sprite name=FS_Citizen> <color=#FFE331>Ratizens</color>!

By using the [Command] control, you can order your ratizens to do tasks for you.
Try ordering a ratizen to start <sprite name=FS_Gathering><color=#FFE331>Gathering</color> plant resources for you.
When an assigned task is completed by a ratizen, a certain amount of <sprite name=FS_Gold><color=#FFE331>Money</color> is given to the ratizens. This money is pulled from the economy's money pool.
Enough resources were gathered to build a <sprite name=FS_Production><color=#FFE331>Lumber Mill</color>. Use [Command] to issue an order to build it.
The construction is finished! Please use [DetailCheck] on the building to assign a <sprite name=FS_Citizen><color=#FFE331>Ratizen</color> to work!
When a ratizen gets tired, they sleep. If a ratizen is  given a <sprite name=FS_Base><color=#FFE331>bed</color> to sleep in, they will recover their <color=#FFE331>Stamina</color> much faster.
Note that every ratizen must be assigned a bed of their own. Use [DetailCheck} on a bed and assign a ratizen to a bed.
Be careful, there are <sprite name=FS_Level><color=#c83232>weird rats</color> approaching the town!
This situation seems dangerous; build <sprite name=FS_Military><color=#FFE331>Military Structures</color> to protect your ratizens!

Whenever you find a new <color=#FFE331>resource</color> and it's deposited in a Storage, or a ratizen finishes a job in the laboratory, you will get a <sprite name=FS_ResearchPoint><color=#FFE331>Research Point</color>.

Use [Command2] and select the research page. Use a <sprite name=FS_ResearchPoint><color=#FFE331>Research Point</color> to research and create new structures.
It would be wise to begin with researching a <sprite name=FS_Service><color=#FFE331>circus stand</color> first.
It's great to see your city is developing! Now is a great time to work on stabilizing your city's economy.
You can <color=#FFE331>collect</color> <sprite name=FS_Tax> <color=#FFE331>tax</color> from ratizens by using [Interaction] on a rat that has the option available.
The government savings is not sufficient! Try collecting more taxes or minting money.

In addition to using the [Interaction] button to collect taxes, you can build a <sprite name=FS_Service><color=#FFE331>Tax office</color> that automatically collects <sprite name=FS_Tax><color=#FFE331>Taxes</color>  from ratizens.
Some ratizens are falling into the pit of despair! If you leave them as they are, they may end up doing something unfavorable and extreme!
Build different <sprite name=FS_Service><color=#FFE331>service</color> structures to make ratizens happy and restore their <sprite name=FS_Happiness><color=#FFE331>Happiness</color> level!
As the diversity between rats increases with more ratizens, they are finding it harder to trust one another and are anxious about the future.

There's someone with the <sprite name=FS_QuestMark><color=#FFE331>mission</color>! 
Interact with [Interaction] to check their request.

You are low on <sprite name=FS_Health><color=#c83232>HP</color>! 
It's all over if you fall.
Taking rest on the <sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>Royal bed</color> would be a great option.

A ratizen got <sprite name=FS_Injury><color=#c83232>wounded</color>! 
Transport the wounded to <sprite name=FS_Base><color=#FFE331>bed</color>, the ratizen might get better.

There is a <sprite name=FS_Death><color=#c83232>dead</color> ratizen!
If you let there be corpse around, it will ruin all the ratizens. Build a <sprite name=FS_Base><color=#FFE331>tomb</color> to honor the dead.

There's no active <sprite name=FS_Base><color=#FFE331>storage</color>!
The base tile or the storage itself might be<color=#c83232>destroyed</color>.
Please check and fix.
All the tutorials can also be found on the  [Menu]<color=#FFE331>Menu</color>'s <color=#FFE331>Help</color> section.
Since now there are ratizens to work, please try building a  <sprite name=FS_Production> <color=#FFE331>Lumber Mill</color> and produce <sprite name=LumberObject> <color=#FFE331>Lumbers</color>
Now, please build <sprite name=FS_Service><color=#FFE331>Service</color> structures to make ratizens settle down with comfort.

Build <sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>Code Stone</color> to activate <color=#FFE331>Policy</color> page. 
Aim <sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>Code Stone</color> and use [DetailCheck], or use [Command2] to check <color=#FFE331>Policy</color> page to set tax law.

<sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>Code Stone</color> has been built!
Aim the <sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>Code Stone</color> or use [Command2] to check <color=#FFE331>Policy</color> page to set policies.
You have to build a <sprite name=FS_Decoration><color=#FFE331>Foundation Monument</color> to relieve them, make them feel a sense of belonging and give certainty for the future.
Terrific! I guess you are totally fine.
All the <color=#FFE331>interactions</color> are based on the aim, so please remember [AllDir2] well.
From now on, I'll teach you what you might not be used to. So please follow my direction.
Firstly, let me teach you how to <color=#FFE331>interact</color> with objects, starting with how to <sprite name=FS_Gathering><color=#FFE331>Gather</color>.
With [Interaction], you can <color=#FFE331>interact</color> with the object in the aimed area.
<color=#FFE331>Interaction</color> includes various actions, and <sprite name=FS_Gathering><color=#FFE331>Gather</color> is one of those.
Try to move, aim, and interact to gather <sprite name=LogObject><color=#FFE331>Logs</color> from <color=#FFE331>Broadleaf Tree</color>.
When holding items, aim the place to put the items in, and use [Interaction].
Please aim at the <sprite name=FS_Base><color=#FFE331>Storage</color> and use [Interaction] put in the resources!
Great work. When not fully removed, plants will grow back after some time.
The next is <sprite name=FS_Mining><color=#FFE331>Mining</color>. You can <sprite name=FS_Mining><color=#FFE331>Mine</color> with, surprisingly, [Interaction].
You can <sprite name=FS_Mining><color=#FFE331>Mine</color> to get resources from <color=#FFE331>tiles</color>.
Move, aim, and interact to get <sprite name=DirtObject><color=#FFE331>dirt</color> and put those in the <sprite name=FS_Base><color=#FFE331>storage</color>.
Well done. But beware not to dig too deep, you might not be able to get out.
Now, using the resources gathered, let's try to <sprite name=FS_Building><color=#FFE331>Build</color> a <sprite name=FS_House><color=#FFE331>structure</color>.

To <sprite name=FS_Building><color=#FFE331>Build</color>, follow three steps: place <sprite name=FS_Blueprint>blueprint, supply <sprite name=FS_BuildResource>resources, and <sprite name=FS_Building>build.
Use [Command] to open the command menu and place a <sprite name=FS_Base><color=#FFE331>ladder</color>.
Great job! After supplying the resources, the <sprite name=FS_Blueprint><color=#FFE331>blueprint</color> becomes ready-to-build.
Interact with the ready-to-build <sprite name=FS_Blueprint><color=#FFE331>blueprint</color> to finish <sprite name=FS_Building><color=#FFE331>building</color>!
Great! I bet you've not been used it before, but <sprite name=FS_Base><color=#FFE331>Ladders</color> are quite helpful to climb up and down.
Remember that only tile objects such as<sprite name=FS_Base><color=#FFE331>ladders</color>, <color=#FFE331>blocks</color>, and <color=#FFE331>roofs</color> can be placed in the midair.
I guess you've learnt the basics well enough.
Since you know the basic actions, lets bring the wandering ratizens to the city.
But to do so, <sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>City entrance</color> is needed.
So why don't we build one? <sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>City entrance</color> is in the <sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>Royal structures</color> category.
Where other objects are located, <sprite name=FS_Blueprint><color=#FFE331>blueprint</color> cannot be placed.
If you place <sprite name=FS_Blueprint><color=#FFE331>blueprints</color> on the nature tiles, <sprite name=FS_Mining><color=#FFE331>Mine</color> order will be placed.
Keep in mind that to build most of the structures like <sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>City entrance</color>, <color=#FFE331>ground</color> fit to the structure's horizontal size is needed.
Finally it is time to accept some migrants!
Aim the city entrance, use (UI)[DetailCheck] to accept the migrants to make them <sprite name=FS_Citizen><color=#FFE331>Ratizens</color> of the city.

Various groups of <sprite name=FS_Immigrant><color=#FFE331>migrants</color> will visit <sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>City entrance</color>. However, accepting several groups at once could have unforeseen consequences.
Thus there is no other choice than to accept only a single group at a time.
Before accepting the migrants, use [DetailCheck] to check the details.
Now, please choose whom to live with.
The accepted migrants become <sprite name=FS_Citizen><color=#FFE331>Ratizens</color> of the city and follow your orders.
<sprite name=FS_Citizen><color=#FFE331>Ratizens</color> work with certain priorities: job, build, gather, mine, and transport.
So the best way to modify their action priorities is to assign the ratizen on a certain structure.

But currently, there's no job. So give <sprite name=FS_Gathering><color=#FFE331>Gather order</color> using [Command] to make the Ratizens gather <sprite name=GrainObject><color=#FFE331>grains</color>.
Terrific! Most of the plant objects grow over time. So consider whether to remove them for space, or to wait for the next harvest.
Objects like <sprite name=GrainObject><color=#FFE331>grains</color> can be used as <sprite name=FS_Food><color=#FFE331>Food</color> for ratizens.
When starved too much, ratizens might <sprite name=FS_Death><color=#FFE331>Die</color>. Please supply enough <sprite name=FS_Food><color=#FFE331>Food</color> to prevent such happenings.
In addition, Ratizen's <color=#FFE331>Happiness</color> get's affected by <sprite name=FS_Cleanliness><color=#FFE331>Hygiene</color> and <sprite name=FS_Fun><color=#FFE331>Joy</color>.

So this time, let's build toilet for basic <sprite name=FS_Cleanliness><color=#FFE331>Hygiene</color>. <sprite name=FS_Service><color=#FFE331>Toilet</color> is in the <sprite name=FS_Service><color=#FFE331>Service structures</color> category.
Great work! Maintaining enough service facilities is key to maintaining ratizens' happiness.

Ratizens also consume <sprite name=FS_Life><color=#FFE331>Necessities</color>, and distinguish themselves into classes by how much goods and <sprite name=FS_Gold><color=#FFE331>wealth</color> they are holding..
But, the knowledge we got after the catastrophe is not even enough to fulfill the basic needs of <sprite name=FS_Fun><color=#FFE331>Joy</color>!
So, now it's time to build a <sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>Research table</color> to research for the people, the city, and mostly, for yourself.
To make one, you will need some <sprite name=LumberObject><color=#FFE331>Lumber</color>. Build <sprite name=FS_Production><color=#FFE331>Sawmill</color> to process some wood.
Enough resources have stored to <sprite name=FS_Building><color=#FFE331>Build</color>!
It's time to build a <sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>Research Desk</color>.
Construction finished! Get to <sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>Research Desk</color> and use [DetailCheck]!
As more <sprite name=FS_Citizen><color=#FFE331>ratizens</color> gather, the need of policies to rule them grows.
Well, total freedom could be an option too, but building a <sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>Code stone</color> to legalize policies might be a better choice.
With the <sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>Code stone</color>, various policies can be set to rule the city easier, so please try using it.
Construction finished! Use [DetailCheck] on <sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>Code stone</color> to clarify the <sprite name=FS_Scroll_Criminal1><color=#FFE331>Policies</color> for the city!
You can activate various types of policies. For example, you can <sprite name=FS_Tax><color=#FFE331>Tax</color> the ratizens with <sprite name=FS_TaxLaw><color=#FFE331>tax laws</color>.
With <sprite name=FS_Scroll_Trade><color=#FFE331>Commercial laws</color>, you can encourage or prohibit ratizens to consume certain products or services.
Using <sprite name=FS_WelfareLaw><color=#FFE331>Welfare laws</color> will allow you to relief the poor, or enrich the ratizen's living standards.
If you want to restrict the citizens when to work or rest, then use <sprite name=FS_Scroll_Criminal1><color=#FFE331>Labor laws</color> to set the schedules based on the time of day.
Activated <sprite name=FS_Scroll_Criminal1><color=#FFE331>policies</color> are applied at a specific time every day. Try to establish rightful laws and lead the city towards to the ideal state.
There's a ratizen with a <sprite name=FS_QuestMark><color=#FFE331>request</color>! Get close to the ratizen and use [Interaction] to check.
The choice will lead to a consequence, so please consider wisely.
<sprite name=FS_Health><color=#c83232>HP</color> too low!
It's all over if you fall. You need to take care of yourself more.
Taking rest on the <sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>Royal bed</color> would be a great option to heal yourself.
A ratizen got <sprite name=FS_Injury><color=#c83232>Wounded</color>!
Transport the wounded to <sprite name=FS_Base><color=#FFE331>bed</color>. The ratizen might get better.
There is a <sprite name=FS_Death><color=#c83232>dead</color> ratizen!
If you let there be a <sprite name=FS_Death><color=#c83232>dead</color> around, many will question about the leadership.
Build a <sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>Tomb</color> to honor the deads to prevent this from happening.
There will be many times that the objects are in a same spot like this.
In such moment, simply use [MoveNext] to aim on the intended object.
Try using [MoveNext] now!
Your highness! Only a single type of item with certain number can be held at once.
To pick up other items, use [DropObj] to drop the item you're currently holding.
There's no active <sprite name=FS_Base><color=#FFE331>Storage</color>!
Please check whether the base is collapsed, or the storage got damaged.
If the base is collapsed, fill up the empty tiles to re-activate the structure.
Use [LeftDir2][RightDir2] to change the categories without leaving the screen. Try [LeftDir2][RightDir2] when you need!
Before you choose the structures to build, you can check the detailed information with [DetailCheck]. Try [DetailCheck] now!
Most of the structures can be checked in details with [DetailCheck], as you've just done.
To use the structure's function, please use [AllDir] and [Interaction]. Then use [Interaction] to check the resources stored.
With [MoveNext], you can put in or take out what you are holding, or what is stored.
In some structures, resources to gather or produce can be selected.
However, most structures do not operate without Ratizens. Try deploying Ratizens first to get the structure running!
You can check the detailed information of the ratizen on the right side. Check and assign a ratizen fits to the job.
Assigned ratizen can be changed whenever needed. However the work progress will be reset.
Well done. Only when enough resources are stored, <sprite name=FS_Blueprint><color=#FFE331>blueprint</color> can be placed.
When there are ratizens, they would supply and build, but now you should do it yourself.
Whenever you misplaced a <sprite name=FS_Blueprint><color=#FFE331>blueprint</color>, you can cancel with the <sprite name=FS_Cancel><color=#FFE331>cancel order</color>.
When a <sprite name=FS_Blueprint><color=#FFE331>blueprint</color> is placed on tiles, they have to be mined before the construction.
Use (UI)[DetailCheck] on storage to take resources for the <sprite name=FS_Blueprint><color=#FFE331>blueprint</color>.
It's already the second time welcoming the visitors! They all seem fine to settle down.
But whenever there's none you like, or there's no space in the city, use [Escape] to postpone the decision.
On the research screen, you can unlock the new structures.
Just as the building menu, use (Player)[AllDir] and (UI)[LeftDir2](UI)[RightDir2] to move around.

You will need <sprite name=FS_ResearchPoint><color=#FFE331>Research points</color> for the research. It can be gained by collecting new resources or be produced from the <sprite name=FS_Production><color=#FFE331>Laboratory</color>.
Collected <sprite name=FS_ResearchPoint><color=#FFE331>Research point</color> can be checked on the category at the end.
But before researching something, use [DetailCheck] to check the detailes about the structure.
With [DetailCheck], you can check the ingredients and products of the structure like this.
Use [DetailCheck] again to check more details. Use it before researching to prevent the waste.
Some of the structures have additional options, such as <color=#FFE331>affecting area</color>. Check with [LeftDir2][RightDir2]!
When the affected area is too big or small, efficiency could be reduced. Set it wisely!

<sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>Bank</color> is one of the strutures that do not need a ratizen to be assigned. It allow you to <sprite name=FS_Loan><color=#FFE331>Loan</color> and <sprite name=FS_Exchange><color=#FFE331>Exchange</color>.
<sprite name=FS_Loan><color=#FFE331>Loan</color> works just like storing items in storage. But before getting a loan, check the options carefully.
The interest will automatically charged until you repay <sprite name=FS_Loan><color=#FFE331>loaned</color> option.

<sprite name=FS_Exchange><color=#FFE331>Exchange</color>is a function to trade the national currency of <sprite name=FS_Gold><color=#FFE331>Pia</color> and the international currency of <sprite name=FS_Dar><color=#33CC33>Dar</color>.
<sprite name=FS_Dar><color=#33CC33>Dar</color> can be used to trade with certain foreign countries.
Base rate of exchange changes every day by randomly selecting a exchange card from the deck.
Exchange cards can be collected through various events.
In the <sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>Trading Center</color>, you can conduct trade with nations discovered through exploration.
In the <sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>Diplomatic Office</color>, you can explore the surrounding areas through the map. It is possible to reserve exploration for up to three areas.
During exploration, you can discover other cities. By giving gifts to the discovered cities, you can increase the <sprite name=FS_Relations><color=#FFE331>Relations</color>.

Once sufficient <sprite name=FS_Relations><color=#FFE331>Relations</color> are accumulated, you can conduct trade with that city through the <sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>Trading Center</color>.
You can begin <sprite name=FS_Trade><color=#FFE331>Trade</color>, either to import or export, after setting amounts and number of trade.
<sprite name=FS_Trade><color=#FFE331>Traded</color> items will be saved and removed from the set storage. Make sure that the storage has empty space.
Among the <sprite name=FS_Military><color=#FFE331>Military structures</color>, training facilities train ratizens to become soldiers. Trained soldiers defeat invading enemies.
When ratizens are assigned to a <sprite name=FS_Military><color=#FFE331>training structures</color>, they will need some time to be properly trained.
If the time was not enough, they will not join the battle as soldiers, so spare enough time.
Soldiers get paid every day automatically, so consider it wisely when recruiting them.
In the <sprite name=FS_Military><color=#FFE331>training structures</color>, you can choose the soldier type to be trained.
Each type has certain abilities, so choose the one that matches with your needs.
When the type get changed, the ratizen will need to be trained again.
Trained soldiers can be placed on <sprite name=FS_Military><color=#FFE331>Squad Headquarter</color> to follow direct orders.
Place the soldiers and use (Player)[Command] on the battle mode to give battle orders!
Deployed soldiers on <sprite name=FS_Military><color=#FFE331>Squad Headquarter</color> will prioritize the direct orders.
In additions, those deployed on <sprite name=FS_Military><color=#FFE331>Squad Headquarter</color> will enter the dungeons with you.
However, they will grow hungry and tired if the operations take too long. So be wary of that.
<sprite name=FS_Level><color=#FFE331>Enemies</color> digged a hole to invade the city! The city is in danger!
If there is <sprite name=FS_Service><color=#FFE331>Hospital</color>, wounded ratizens can take care of their health before they get serious.
In addition, doctors will be able to move and heal the <sprite name=FS_Injury><color=#c83232>wounded</color> within the area.
Think of the supply and demand carefully, and built enough <sprite name=FS_Service><color=#FFE331>hospitals</color> for the city.
On the (Player)[Command2] button menu, you can check various information about the city.
With <sprite name=FS_Statistics><color=#FFE331>Statistics</color>, you can check information about the city's prosperity, savings, ratizens, structures, resources, and policies.
<sprite name=FS_ResearchPoint><color=#FFE331>Research Check</color> lets you check information on the research list, even if you cannot begin the research.
With <sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>Leader</color>, you can check your condition, abilities, and equipment you are using.
With <sprite name=FS_Filter><color=#FFE331>Filter</color>, you will be able to check the city and ratizens with various bias-lenses.
Using the <sprite name=FS_Alarm><color=#FFE331>Check Alarm</color> feature, you can check the Ratizens corresponding to various alarms in the top left corner.
If you dig in to much, you might get isolated!
When path is cut, it might really get hard to return.
This time, I'll help you to come out. Beware not to get too deep without a passage.
You can order to <sprite name=FS_Gathering><color=#FFE331>Gather</color> by aiming on the target object, and use [Interaction].
While using [Interaction], you can control the area to order on various targets.
Anything within the area that is possible to be gathered will be ordered to be gathered.
While ordering, use [MoveNext] to cancel orders. This function can be used on the other orders too.
When <sprite name=FS_Gathering><color=#FFE331>Gather order</color> is given, ratizens will gather the ordered objects, no matter if it is fully grown or not.
You can order to <sprite name=FS_Mining><color=#FFE331>Mine</color> by aiming at the targer tile, and using [Interaction].
While using [Interaction], you can control the area to order on various tiles
Anything within the area that is possible to be mined will be ordered to be mined.
Be careful when giving <sprite name=FS_Mining><color=#FFE331>Mine</color> order since it can change the landscape. Ratizens could be isolated or structure's base could be destroyed.
You can <sprite name=FS_Cancel><color=#FFE331>Cancel</color>  the order with [Interaction] button on the ordered area.
<sprite name=FS_Cancel><color=#FFE331>Canceling</color> is possible on Gather, Mine, Demolish, Repair, and Build orders.
<sprite name=FS_Cancel><color=#FFE331>Canceling</color> an order takes effect immediately. If you have canceled the wrong order, you'll need to issue it again.
You can order to <sprite name=FS_Repair><color=#FFE331>Repair</color> using [Interaction] on damaged structures.
Natural objects however cannot be repaired.
<sprite name=FS_Repair><color=#FFE331>Repair</color> has higher priority than build, so use it wisely depending on the situation.
Whenever you misplace a structure or tile, you can remove it with <sprite name=FS_Demolition><color=#FFE331>Demolish</color> order.
<sprite name=FS_Demolition><color=#FFE331>Demolish</color> order can only be given to artificial objects.
When removing ladders or tiles, beware that the structures' foundation could be destroyed, or ratizens' paths could get blocked.
You can get all the resources used to build the structure, so use it wisely when you need it!
The structure lacks of resources!
Please check the structure and solve the issue.
Becareful! Weird acting rats are approaching to the city!
Draw your weapon with [WeaponOn]! Let's do some "interactions" with those invaders!
A <sprite name=FS_Criminal><color=#FFE331>Crime</color> has occurred!
Currently, it's a minor offense like theft. But if left unchecked, it will lead to more serious crimes.
Build a <sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>Prison</color> or a <sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>Police Station</color> to rehabilitate the criminals.
This is the <color=#FFE331>Entrance of a Dungeon</color>, filled with unknown threats.
The expected level of threat is indicated by the difficulty.
While it's possible to embark on this journey alone, I strongly recommend you to bring along guards.
Please note that the progress cannot be recored in the dungeon!
Weasels have found our habitat!
Those scurrilous babarians will build posts near the city and even make new paths to invade.
However, if we gather our force together, it won't be that hard to defeat them.
I'll just keep scouting! Good luck, leader!
By explore, the unknown areas on the map can be revealed.
This will used up some resources and time depends on distance and number of crew.
On the revealed area, there could be other cities, terrains, resources, or some happenings.
I hope you explore unknown territories through exploration and promote national interests.
You can establish diplomatic relations with other nations discovered through exploration.
By maintaining diplomacy, you can build up good Relations; the higher the Relations points, the more benefits arise from interactions with that nation.
Alternatively, instead of building a relationship, you could invade them and turn them into a tributary state.
I hope you will promote the national interest through wise diplomatic relations.
By using <sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>Trading Center</color>, trade agreements can be made with nations with good Relations.
Additionally, the higher the Relations points, the fewer disadvantages occur in import and export prices.
Each country handles products differently based on their prosperity, and prices can vary over time, so please check thoroughly before making agreements.
I hope you will promote the national interest through systematic trade.
In the <sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>Bank</color>, loans and currency exchange are available.
When taking out a loan, the available products are provided by foreign cities with whom you have diplomatic relations.
Please make sure to check the loan amount and interest rates, and be careful not to break the hard-earned trust relationship.
I hope you will promote the national interest through systematic financial transactions.
Through the <sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>Ratizen Register</color>, you can designate groups of citizens.
You can apply labor laws and other regulations to the designated groups, or restrict access using doors.
To create other groups or to place a Ratizen in multiple groups, please build an additional <sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>Ratizen Register</color>!
<sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>Mail Box</color> is a structure that allows you to give orders from a distance.
Facilities within the range of the <sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>Mail Box</color> can be operated using the statistics window of the management function via (Player)[Command2].
Although the commands you can give are limited to simple tasks, it can be quite useful depending on the situation.
When holding an item, actions other than putting in the items are not possible!
To perform other interactions, please use[DropObj] to drop the item first.
Ratizens tend to express their dissatisfaction when it accumulates.
Aim and use [DetailCheck] to check why that suspicious ratizen acts like that!
Some structures has options to change with (UI)[LeftDir2](UI)[RightDir2] before placing blueprints.
For example, when you place beds, you can either set auto or manual assignment!
Research points are running out!
In addition to new resources, research points can also be produced by building a <sprite name=FS_Production><color=#FFE331>Laboratory</color>. Please remember this.
All production facilities can be set to produce items according to the conditions by setting the task conditions.
Please enable working conditions through the building settings as needed, and then select the production resources!
This feature can be enabled globally through the game options!
If the Task condition is activated, you can specify to produce or halt resources according to the conditions.
You can assign tasks based on the quantity of materials or products, so please make good use of it.
In production and gathering Structures, you can designate various Resources as needed.
If you specify multiple Resources in a production Structure, it will produce those items sequentially.
As you can see in the Resource information window, the same Resource can be made from different materials!
If the material Resources are insufficient, or do not meet the set Task conditions, it will produce the next designated item.
If there is no possibility to produce anything, be aware that it will carry out general commands.
You can activate up to 3 trade agreements per country.
Please be aware that if you want to terminate an agreement before its expiration, you will have to pay a penalty!
In the trade status category, you can check the current trade status for each country.
You can terminate ongoing agreements, or delete and renew expired trade agreements.
If expired agreements accumulate, it becomes impossible to form new agreements, so please don't forget to remove unnecessary agreements.
Functions in the (Player)[Command2] menu are not essential, but used well are very helpful! Please get used to this menu, Leader!
Through tax law, conditions can be set to impose taxes on Ratizens.
Taxes are levied at midnight, and the imposed taxes must be collected directly from each Ratizen.
Unpaid taxes continuously accumulate. Accumulated taxes are collected all at once when collecting taxes.
Be careful if taxes accumulate excessively, as Ratizens may run out of money after tax collection and face difficulties.
Problems tend to arise if taxes are too low or too high. It is advised to find the right amount of tax for the city through various methods.
Through commercial law, you can legally change factors related to the consumption of Ratizens.
You can change the price of Resources or labor wages, or make it possible to consume items that couldn't be consumed due to class restrictions.
Commercial law is really useful, but it is advised to set it carefully considering the economic level of Ratizens and the necessity of consumption.
Through the Welfare law, various subsidies can be provided to Ratizens.
Unlike taxes, subsidies do not need to be delivered individually; they are directly transferred from the Savings.
Decide whether to provide regular subsidies or to grant subsidies when certain goods are consumed!
Although subsidies are considered income, please consider that they are delivered after tax calculations at midnight.
Under the Labor law, you can set Ratizens' work schedules or adjust work priorities.
For work schedules, you can enforce specific times for sleeping, working, resting, etc.
Adjusting work priorities can prohibit the execution of certain commands or prioritize them over others.
The Labor law is particularly effective when used in combination with <sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>Ratizen Register</color>, so consider using them together.
The city is flourishing quite well!
As the city grows, it might become more difficult to check and manage various information...
By using [Command2], you can access Admin functions and more easily check information!
Resources with Class restrictions have been produced!
Please note that some resources and Structures can only be consumed by specific Classes.
This information can be found in the information for each resource and Structure.
Additionally, through commercial law, you can change Class restrictions, so make good use of it.
A Structure with Class restrictions has been constructed!
Please note that some resources and Structures can only be consumed by specific Classes.
This information can be found in the information for each resource and Structure.
Additionally, through commercial law, you can change Class restrictions, so make good use of it.
You've produced your first <sprite name=FS_Life><color=#FFE331>Necessity</color>!
Ratizens consume various Necessities and lead happier lives.
Additionally, with sufficient Necessities and money, they can belong to a higher Class.
The remaining Necessities and money needed to reach the next Class can be found in the individual details of each Ratizen.
<sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>Royal Forge</color> allows you to craft and equip gear directly.
Press Equipment Crafting/Equipment Equipping to check the information!
Equipment is divided into weapons, armor, and accessories, and you can equip one item per category.
To craft equipment, the necessary resources must be present in the city.
Each piece of equipment has various traits, so lead your citizens with gear that suits the situation.
Crafting equipment is surprisingly simple! You just need to hammer at the right moment.
That right moment is when the node flying from the right reaches the marked position on the anvil.
Of course, if you make too many mistakes with the hammering, you could fail the crafting.
Even if you fail, the crafting materials will not disappear, so don't worry and give it a try.
<sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>Shrine</color> allows you to utilize various effective abilities.
Only one shrine can be activated at a time, and to activate its abilities, a certain amount of offerings must be sacrificed.
The shrine's abilities are divided into Passive and Active skills. Passive effects are always in effect while the shrine is activated.
Active skills can be used by pressing the [Skill] button and have a cooldown period.
Use the shrine's abilities to actively lead your city!
To assist in your understanding of engineering research, I will provide a brief explanation.
Generators produce <sprite name=FS_ElectricPower><color=#FFE331>Electricity</color> every hour or once a certain workload is completed.
The generated Electricity is transmitted through <color=#FFE331>wires</color> to the <sprite name=FS_Battery><color=#FFE331>Electricity Storage</color>.
If the Storage is full or there is no Storage, the produced Electricity <color=#FFE331>disappears</color>.
Storage supplies the Electricity received from the power plant to nearby <sprite name=FS_UseWatt><color=#FFE331>Electricity consumption</color> structures
Electricity consumption structures automatically connect to the Storage within its effective range and receive Electricity.
Most of the electricity consumption structures consume Electricity <color=#FFE331>every hour</color>.
It is advised to properly coordinate production, storage, and consumption to utilize without shortage!
<sprite name=FS_MakeWatt><color=#FFE331>Generating Electricity</color> structures produce electricity every hour or upon completion of a task.
The generated electricity is transmitted to the connected <sprite name=FS_Battery><color=#FFE331>Electricity Storage</color> structure.
Please be aware that if there is no connected storage or if the storage capacity is full, the generated electricity will be <color=#FFE331>lost</color>.

<sprite name=FS_Battery><color=#FFE331>Electricity Storage</color> structures store electricity supplied from <sprite name=FS_MakeWatt><color=#FFE331>Generating Electricity</color> structures connected by Transmission Wire or Transmission Block.
Electricity Storage structures also supply electricity to <sprite name=FS_UseWatt><color=#FFE331>Consuming Electricity</color> structures.
Ensure you have a sufficient <sprite name=FS_Battery><color=#FFE331>Electricity Storage</color> capacity by carefully managing supply, storage, and consumption rates so it does not fall short.
<sprite name=FS_UseWatt><color=#FFE331>Consuming Electricity</color> structures can be connected to a storage without using transmission wires or blocks.
Consuming Electricity structures consume power from the connected storage to be activated.
Most Consuming Electricity structures use power every hour and will be <color=#FFE331>deactivated</color> if they do not receive sufficient power.
Cute and fragile <sprite name=FS_Drone><color=#FFE331>drones</color> are a great way to quickly progress through simple tasks.
Each <sprite name=FS_Queen><color=#FFE331>Drone Hangar</color> is equipped with three drones, which perform one type of designated <color=#FFE331>Order</color>.
If you wish the drones to perform a different order, please change the order!
Note that drones cannot execute orders outside the range of their hangar.
<sprite name=FS_GBot><color=#FFE331>Ratron</color> is an excellent technology that can perform the hard work of Ratizens instead.
Ratrons do not need to eat, have fun, or take care of hygiene! Just charging them is enough.
However, they do not grow, and for various reasons, the number that can be operated is limited...
Please try assembling it by putting in the necessary resources according to the desired capability!
If you adjust the output well during the Ratron assembly stage, you can produce a Ratron of better quality.
As soon as you start pulling the lever, charging begins, and when you release the lever, the charged energy is delivered.
If you adjust the output to match all the same attributes, a Ratron with those attribute bonuses will be produced!
Now, let's activate the machine and try making one.
Tesla Towers are exceptional facilities that can transmit electricity wirelessly by connecting to other Tesla Towers.
The power networks of the two connected Tesla Towers are combined into one power network.
However, please be careful as attempting to connect to a Tesla Tower that is already connected to another will disconnect the existing connection.
You can use the Headquarter to observe the battlefield, deploy soldiers, and initiate battles.
Observe the battlefield to identify the terrain and enemy soldiers, and deploy soldiers to your War Banner!
Soldiers can also be deployed by interacting with individual banners, without using the Headquarter.
When you are ready, press the "Initiate Battle" button to start the battle!
You can use the Exploration Office to explore unexplored areas or to obtain resources from already explored areas.
To explore, you need an unemployed Ratizen, and you must provide food and costs.
The time required for exploration is proportional to the abilities of the assigned Ratizens.
If you discover another city during the exploration, proceed with diplomacy through the Diplomatic Office!
You can conduct diplomacy with the cities discovered by the Exploration Office.
If there are discovered cities, select the respective city to engage in various diplomatic activities!
You can perform actions such as giving gifts, opening trade routes, proposing alliances, condemning, and declaring war with each city.
Descriptions of each action can be found by clicking on the respective action.
If you have opened a trade route with a city discovered through exploration in the Diplomatic Office, you can proceed with trade.
Each city has unique resources, and the items and quantities for sale increase according to their Prosperity.
Additionally, the resources handled change with each season.
Don't worry, the agreements you've already made will remain valid even if the resources change!
